content:
So in the discussions about the roadmap, we established that we want to try out regular meetings.

I suggest we do those bi-weekly the day (or two days) before syncing the Rust and Clippy repo. To find a time, I created a doole poll. I think most of the Clippy team members are based somewhere in the CET timezone, so I chose times during working hours in this time zone. If I'm mistaken with that assumption and you can't participate during one of those times, please let me know! (The date in the poll would be the date of the first meeting. But make sure, that you are free at this time every other week, not only on that date)

Everyone who is interested in participating in those meetings can enter times in the poll. Answers by team members will be weighted a bit more, though. As team members, I count every active reviewer (@Philipp Hansch @llogiq @Manish Goregaokar @Eduardo Broto) and every triager (@Takayuki Nakata @Cameron Steffen). Folks who were reviewers for Clippy before are also invited to leave their vote, maybe meetings will inspire you to get more involved in Clippy again :wink: (@matthiaskrgr @Jane Lusby @oli). I hope I didn't forget anyone.
Thanks for your mention! My timezone is JST, so I'll try to participate if I can.

If we should set the time of the meeting, where you can't participate, its more a loss for us, than for you. The meeting will be in text-form on zulip, so you can read through it and comment afterwards. If you have something that you would want to bring up, you can add that to the agenda beforehand (by e.g. creating the meeting thread earlier or writing me a dm).
Greetings from Chicago! :)
@llogiq You're the last one missing in the doodle poll of the active team members. I want to finalize the poll on Sunday.

So now that every team member has filled in the poll, we got a time: 2021-01-12T17:00:00+01:00

Can you all make the first meeting tomorrow ( :check: ) or should we push it back 2 weeks ( :cross_mark: )?
fyi, you can do <time: to have zulip format the time for everyone correctly, e.g., right now it is 2021-01-11T09:55:00-05:00
Thanks, so the meeting time would be: 2021-01-12T17:00:00+01:00
@simulacrum Can we just use the triagebot for the meeting or do we need to set something up to use it?
hm, not sure what you mean - @triagebot end-meeting should work anywhere on this zulip

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
but that and @triagebot end-topic are the only two meeting-specific features I believe

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
That's exactly what I meant! Thanks!
let me know if other questions are useful (or feel free to post a PR, they're actually really quite easy to add), rust-lang/triagebot and zulip.rs
@flip1995 can you send out a calendar invite?

ideally a recurring one

oh wait, I didn't press save, after adding all the people :D

I would like to join in as well if that's okay. :upside_down: Could you also add me under xFrednet@gmail.com? Or do you prefer to just post the meeting link somewhere else for non-team members? @flip1995
The meeting will be just in this Zulip channel. So everyone can join. I also sent you an invite :+1:
Ah okay, thank you! :+1:
@flip1995 f.seasons017@gmail.com thanks, although I may not be able to attend that time.

Thanks!
